text: sample direct from foeder during toer de gueuze 2017hazy, medium amber with sharp, earthy, carbonic, woody nose. light carbonation, lemon, acid, rotting wood, slightly vegetal, shar dry finish. not my favourite jonge lambic

Glass at the Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation. Hazy orange with no head. Aroma of toffee, citrus, apple notes and oak. Flavour is light to moderate sweet and above moderate sour. Light to light medium bodied with flat carbonation.

Tap at WvdSG. Hazy golden. Sharp lemon, vanilla wood, almost bourbon like nose, grapes, dust. Very interesting and nice aroma. Taste is quite sharp sour, almost vinegar, very light sweet and bitter. Under medium bodied with no real carbonation.
Draft pour at kulminator. Pours a hazy hellow with a white head of foM. The aroma had dry, musty, fruity character, and the taste had that, and then a juicy sweetness. Nicely tart.

Light cloudy yellow pour. Big bubbles. 
Age is 5 months. Smells a bit like pumpkin and brown sugar. Apple and plum taste. Banana. Very much a lot of nice flavors. An excellent jonge lambiek

On draught at In de verzekering. Nice white foamy head, good retention. Hazy yellow golden pour, somewhat murky. I got lime, earth, citric acid and vinegar in the after. Medium sour but full bodied mouth feel. Loved the grainyness, peppery hints and brett flavour.

Timmermanss unblended lambic, tasted at a Weekend der Spontane Gisting years ago; rooty, earthy, quite rough lambic, sharpish and lemony, a tad wry in the finish but complex and funky as to be expected from the genre. In comparison with Girardin, Cantillon, or Lindemans lambics, I found this one to be a bit unrefined - but Im a lambic lover, so glad I tasted this anyway.
(Backlog) at spontaneous fermentation. (3 months) very hazy light golden pour, still. Aroma similar to a witte. Tart, lactic, fruit and leather flavors.

2011. Invecchiata tre anni. Acidità tagliente, astringenza che avvolge il palato intrecciandosi con note leggermente floreali e citriche. Leffetto sul palato, almeno per chi piaciono le acide, è quasi divino. Buonissima! Tutta unaltra cosa rispetto alle altre Timmermans che ho assaggiato!!

Cask @ In de Verzekering tegen de Grote Dorst. Hazy yellow with no head and no lacing. Aroma is really citric and lemony with floral presence, grains cheesy notes, nice funk and wood. Taste is lemony and citric, very tart with light floral notes, wood, hay and vinegar. Light body, Soft carbonation. Dry and mouth puckering. Even in a blind tasting, it would be easily recognizable that its the Timmermans lambic I think. Tasty, but not one I would drink gallons of. Taste side by side with the Girardin Oude Lambik and they couldnt be much more different.

On cask at Grote Dorst. Hazy yellow pour with thin white head. Aroma is quite potent, very distinctly citric, lemony aromas, light graininess, fresh pie dough. Taste is quite tart, lemony, light flouriness. Palate is dry with light carbonation. Actually reminded them of their oud gueuze, similar level of acidity. A bit too potent, but still quite nice.

Handpump at Gents Bierfestival 2013 (taken from notes).
APPEARANCE: light clouded blond beer, nice stable white head? This is a lambic right?
NOSE: nice sourness, little lactic, fruity, grains.
TASTE: nice and sour, sourness spreads all around your mouth! fruity, some peaches. Very nice Lambic!

Enjoyed at the 4de Gents Bierfestival, 2013. This seems to be in that 6 to 12 month age where the appearance is more of a Jonge Lombik so Ill put the rating here.
The sample was tapped out of a beer engine and delivering a hazy deep gold body that supports a semi loose near white head of foam. The aroma offers up soured citrus, slightly moldy grapefruit, sweaty socks and a bit of vinegar. The taste is crisp and heads quickly into puckering tartness. I get lemon and grapefruit and then some soft faintly sweetened vinegar notes. This ends dry and moderately tart. Cool experience.

bab 13
pours hazy blond. soapy small white foam
smell is sour, taste is sour, almost sugary. very nice actualy. it has a thing going on that i can almost feel carbo ? weird, yet good !

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2013 2/II/13 - on tap (cask) @  Brugs Bierfestival 2013 (2013-114) 
Little cloudy light orange beer, no head. Aroma: bit cheesy, citrus, sourish, some yoghurt, bit metallic. MF: no carbon, medium body. Taste: lots of citric acidity (like Napoleon candy http://www.candyblog.net/blog/item/napoleon_bonbon vinegar, lemony, little fruity. Aftertaste: sourish, lemony, peppery, bit fruity, typical bretta flavours, bit metallic.

Golden colour, no head. Aroma of lemon, wood, wood cuttings, citrus, sweets (zuurtjes) and floral notes. Quite sour flavour, lemon, citrus, almost like biting a bonbon napoleon. Very fresh, easy going, sour finish, light wood touch.
Quite brilliant. I really love this stuff.
(From cask -an enormous wooden barrel- @ Brugs Bier Festival 2013)

Apparently cask from a wooden barrel? Sampled @ Brugs Bier Festival 2013. Apparently brewed by a new brewer  one that Uli was quite exited about  things apparently bound to change. Hazy golden, typical bubbles but more than usually. Sour lemon in the nose, very sour lemon sorbet, tad watery with lots of lemon acidity, almost touch added, finding bad similarity with their Oude Geuze, very light flowers. Taste is lemon acidity, almost added, sour lemon sorbet thing, sour apples, served too cold, way too, light flowers, reasonable, lightly lactic sour Obviously flat, light touch watery, Simple but enjoyable, eases the thirst, very easy to seasion a lot, yes this would easy do the trick. Many would probably find this too easy. #25 Unblended Lambic.

Aroma:humle citron grape  Ud.:gylden   Skum:  E.smag:sød lidt sur modrat Krop:let For.:tør  Brus: flad  
 28-5-11@ 20th Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation
Strong barnyard aromas on the nose.  Pours light blonde with no carbonation.  Funky over-ripe lemons with a very tart dry finish.  Very mild and refreshing.  Excellent.

Gravity @ 20th Weekend of Spontaneous Fermenation, Tapperij Beukenhof, Broekstraat 18, Buggenhout, Belgium.Unclear medium yellow colour with virtually none head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, wheat, moderate to light heavy citrus - soured milk, moderate earthy. Flavour is moderate to light light heavy sweet and light acidic with a long duration. Body is medium, texture is watery, carbonation is flat. [20110528]

Tap at the 20th Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation. It pours very cloudy straw yellow, with no head or carbonation. The nose is farmyard, tart lemon and wheat. The taste is sweet apple, tart lemon, Granny Smith apple, grapefruit, lemonade and limeade, with a light acidic finish.
Draft at the source, billed as a jonge lambic.  Cloudy yellow, fluffy white head.  Aroma of lemon peel.  taste starts slightly sweet, then very subtle and soft sourness enters.  Nice.

I had this one fresh from tha barrels in 2005. What a sensation, and to me it was the best fresh geuze i taste during the geuzetour. Lovely golden yellowish colour, very acid nose, but in the tastte there was still fruityness, grainyness, and dryness too, which kept very long. NIce beer with sea food, hot sausages.
Creamy off-white head, mostly diminishing.  Lightly sweet, lightly acidic initial flavour.  Moderately sweet, lightly acidic finish.  Lively mouthfeel.
